characters: WHAT DID YOU THINK WAS GOING TO
WHY DO YOU THINK I AM TRYING TO
WHY ARE YOU TRYING TO KILL ME
MPH SENDING BOTH CARS SPINNING IN A SHOWER OF GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK MOSES lies awake in bed, waiting for the beginning of the day. 4:59 AM changes to 5:00 and he gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing a tattered bathrobe, Frank watches his coffee brew. He's compact and in good shape with broad shoulders and close-cropped hair. He could be 50s, could be 60s - he has this grizzled quality that makes it tough to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the rest of the house, the living room is only nominally furnished: a sofa, lamp, and a shelf of records Frank cranks out a set of pushups. Frank cranks out jumping jacks. Frank cranks out sit-ups. Not crunches... sit-ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank eats two eggs and dry toast at the small table. One small frying pan, one plate, one knife, and one fork are set in the rack to dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing a devastatingly uncool sun hat, Frank picks a lone weed from the dirt around his roses, then stands back to admire them: they're withered and sickly. He looks over sourly at the roses next door: a dazzling array of color. A young MOM comes out of the house with a baby ina stroller.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Moses. Frank puts on a smile and gives her a wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank contemplates a shelf full of cans of BEANS. He starts loading up his cart - at least 50 cans.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER AISLE
dialogues.text: Frank loads up 50 cans of SPINACH.

dialogues.speaker: CHECKOUT COUNTER
dialogues.text: A teenage CASHIER eyes Frank as she rings him up.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Guess you like beans.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: They're all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank puts his groceries away, revealing that his cabinet are already filled with cans. He carefully places the new ones in back, rotating his stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank goes through his mail, tossing the junk, leaving only one letter: a green envelope. He tears it open: a check from the U.S. Government. Pulling an LP from a shelf of vinyl records, Frank drops it onto the stereo and lowers the needle. Picking up the phone, he takes a deep breath and dials.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: May I have your social?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Five four three, six six, two two nine one. Pension services please.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Thank you Mr. Moses. Please hold for your representative. There's a series of CLICKS as the call is transferred.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HUGE OFFICE
dialogues.text: Rows of cubicles stretch out beneath the fluorescent lighting, filled with operators on headsets.  3. SARAH ROSS, older then 30, but we won't say more than that, sits in a cubicle spruced up with spider plants, postcards, and pictures. She's pretty, conservative looking, and bored.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey. It's Frank Moses. She immediately brightens.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey Frank. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Nothing really. I was just calling because I didn't get my check again.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh jeez. I can't believe they haven't worked this out. I'll make sure they get another one out today.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's no big deal. Whenever you get around to it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm just sorry this happened again. Frank leans back, tearing up his check.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? A pause draws out between them. FRANK (cont'd) Well, I guess...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So how are your roses doing? Frank hurriedly answers...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's a massacre. I've got rust and mold. Now I've sprayed them so much they have chemical burns.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You try soapy water?  He lights

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That works?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I swear. Hey what are you listening to? up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's The Chirping Crickets; Buddy Holly's first album in '57.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Never heard it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's before your time. Hell, it's before my time, but it's an amazing record. It has the first released version of "That'll Be the Day." She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You have a lot of free time, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Little bit. Yeah. (beat) I don't have the foggiest idea what to do with myself.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What did you do before you retired?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I was in the diplomatic corps. This strikes a chord.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Really? I'd give anything to travel more.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Believe me, it's not so fun when it's business.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I just want to quit my job and move to Spain for six months.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You should. You'd have an amazing time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see why retirement would be hard. Maybe what you need is to fall in love with something new. Frank smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess so. An annoying looking woman with a pinched face appears at the edge of Sarah's cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: My supervisor. I gotta go. Sarah hangs up and aggressively stares the woman down. SARAH (cont'd) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits on the floor of the darkened room, repeatedly bouncing a rubber ball against the wall and catching it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits at the table in her kitchen eating dinner alon and reading a spy thriller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading inside, Frank sorts through his mail. Two pieces of junk and another green envelope. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah's on her headset.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You need excitement. A passion. Something that makes you feel alive.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FRANK'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Frank dumps a can of spinach into a pot.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Excitement is overrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that? Everyone needs excitement. The most I get is fighting with my mother.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What about?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She keeps trying to set me up on blind dates with her bridge partners' kids. She just told me she's worried I'm gay. (suddenly concerned) I'm not, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Good to know.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think we need to talk about something else. Frank can't help but grin.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What are you reading this week?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Just a romance.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (teasing) Come on. There's a long guilty beat.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It's called Love's Savage Secret. Frank mulls this over.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is it good?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It's terrible! I love it! The lead is a sort of a Britney/Lindsay character marooned on this island with her tennis pro and a prince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Britney Lindsay?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Very funny. Frank was serious, but lets it go.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey, hold on a second, I want you to hear this. He carefully puts on a record and drops the needle. Buddy Holly's THAT'LL BE THE DAY echoes out. They both listen.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I like this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's cool, right?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. They listen for another minute. SARAH (cont'd) I better be getting back to work.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah, course. I didn't mean to keep you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm glad you did. I'll talk to you soon?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits reading Love's Savage Secret, biting his lip as he turns the pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank climbs into bed and turns out the light. The clock changes from 10:59 to 11:00. He lies in the darkness, staring up at the ceiling, waiting to get tired THAT'LL BE THE DAY, fades to a close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be the day-ay-ay that I die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is quiet and still against the suburban night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lies on his bed, staring at the ceiling. It's 3:22. He picks up the glass beside his bed, but it's empty. Getting up, he shrugs into his tattered bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank shuffles out of his bedroom and down the hall to the bathroom. But as he passes the stairs, the CAMERA HOLDS on the darkness of the stairwell... ...and the darkness suddenly comes alive with motion: THR COMMANDOS in hi-tech body armor, night-vision, and weapon are right there. From a small case, the leader takes out a full syringe. The second reaches past him with a snoop scope linked to his heads up display: the hall is clear, the door at the far end swinging closed. They move silently into the hall, listening to the WATER RUN: the leader with the syringe, the second empty-handed ready for the take down, the third with a machine pistol. The bathroom door stands ajar, spilling out bright light. The commandos lift their night-vision as they move down the hall, past the guest room, closing in. WHAM! They kick in the door revealing... ...the empty bathroom... ...as Frank steps out of the darkened guest room behind them in his robe and bare feet. The three men whip around, startled... WHAP! The commando closest to Frank goes down.  9. The second swings, but his legs are swept from under him, Frank's heel crushing his throat as he hits the floor. The leader lunges with the syringe, but it's twisted out of his hand and suddenly in his arm... plunger pressed. Staring at Frank, the commando's eyes flutter and drop. Frank is left standing alone amidst the bodies. He isn't even breathing hard. He crouches down, looking them over without emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank grabs a sledge hammer at the bottom of the stairs, steps to the middle of the room and swings. CRACK! A thin layer of cement shatters. Sweeping fragments away, he pulls out a buried locker. Inside are bricks of cash and an array of passports. Frank quickly stuffs a satchel. Then he unwraps an old 1911 model .45 semiautomatic and adds it as well. Finally he grabs an old set of miliary dog tags and puts them in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank finishes dressing, picks up the phone, and dials.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: May I have your social?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Five four three, six six, two two nine one. Status RED. He hangs up and heads out. But the phone RINGS. He stops, listening to it ECHOING EERILY through the hous Finally he picks it up, holding it to his ear, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Frank Moses? Without answering, Frank moves beside the window, up against the wall, slightly pulling back the drapes and glancing out.  10. A white van is parked at an odd angle across the street, the back door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV from inside the van: WE SEE the bit of curtain move. CLICK: Suddenly it's the same view IN INFRARED, Frank's heat signature clear as day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank catches a glint of light from the van. Exploding into motion, he drops the phone and runs all out down the hall as... PFFT! PFFT! PFFT! Three 40mm grenades are launched into the house and... BOOM! A fireball roars down the hall as... Frank SMASHES through a second floor window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .. hits the roof, and spills into the yard in a shower of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping from the back of the van, a FOURTH COMMANDO slin his six-round grenade launcher and raises binoculars, surveying the destruction. Catching a glimpse of motion he lowers the lenses... ...Frank is twenty feet away, charging straight at him... The commando scrambles for his sidearm but... WHAM! ...-he's tackled straight back into the van. The rear doors are pulled closed, the engine starts, and the van pulls out, disappearing in to the night.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERED TITLE
dialogues.text: Boston rises in the distance behind this cute suburb by the Charles River.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah heads up the walk with a guy a full head shorter than she is.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I had a nice time tonight. Thank you. FRED watches her unlock the door.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to invite me in?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Sorry Fred. Say hi to your mom for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kicking off her shoes, Sarah slides out of her dress and pulls on an oversized shirt already laid out on a chair beside Love's Savage Secret. Settling in, she cracks the book, but then thinks again and gets up. Walking into the kitchen, she grabs a glass, ice, and a pour of bourbon. Then she shakes her head...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Fred. ...and pours a little more. Heading back to her book, she passes Frank. Shrieking, she jumps, the glass smashing on the floor. Sarah grabs a vase to defend herself as Frank puts up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! It's Frank Moses.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Stay back!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's me. (beat) You eat Tasty Cakes for lunch and your mom thinks you're gay. She stares, worlds colliding, her fear turning to anger.  12.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! She protectively pulls down her shirt to cover more of herself, backing away. SARAH (cont'd) What the hell are you doing here? Frank steps forward, hands still up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You have to get out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's not safe here. It's my fault and I'll explain, but right now, I need you to come with me. She stares at him nervously.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think you'd better leave. He picks up a small suitcase from the floor. SARAH (cont'd) That's my bag.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I packed for you. She looks around, reeling.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Did you... do my dishes? Frank's clearly guilty. Pulling it together, she puts on an authoritative tone.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Frank. I always liked you. But I'm not about to... Sarah freezes in fear as he draws his .45. But he's staring past her out the window, where a car pulls up across the street.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Right now, out the back.  13.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere! Frank's torn, feeling the seconds ticking by, not sure how to handle this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I was never a diplomat. I was in the CIA, and someone is trying to kill me. That means there's been surveillance. They've listened to our phone calls and they're going to come after you as leverage.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm calling the police. The car doors open and three men get out, crossing the street toward Sarah's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's behind the wheel with Sarah's purse on his lap, going through it as he smoothly drives, tossing a nail file and her can of pepper spray out the window.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This couldn't be more different from how I hoped to meet you, you know, if we ever even did meet. He comes up with her cell phone and tosses it out too. FRANK (cont'd) But things happen and I think it's important to be flexible. He pauses, taking a breath, knowing it's not going well, but really trying. FRANK (cont'd) You know what I mean? Frank glances back for reassurance. REVEAL Sarah, tied and gagged in the back seat, staring daggers at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As dawn breaks, Frank pulls into this quiet, anonymous ranch-style motel.  14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits on the bed watching Frank warily as he unties her wrists then reaches for the tape on her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sorry. He RIPS it off.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You want some water? She looks at him, scared but in control.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: If you let me go right now, I won't press charges.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm not kidnapping you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What do you think you just did!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You were in danger.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No I wasn't! Even if you aren't completely full of crap and people are after you, no one cares about me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: They know I call you. They've listened.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So what? Frank can't quite look at her, embarrassed. SARAH (cont'd) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dying) They know... I like you. She isn't sure how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You hardly know me.  15.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I know you. She looks away.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: If you're really CIA, why don't you just call them?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don't know how these guys found me. (beat) I have to see someone. I need you to stay here until I get back.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You just want me to sit here?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You'll be perfectly safe. No one knows where you are. He picks up the tape and tears off a fresh piece. She looks at him in confusion and fear. FRANK (cont'd) I'll be back soon. She realizes what's about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No! You crazy kidnapping pervert sonofabitch. You can kiss my... Frank tapes her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERED TITLE
dialogues.text: WILLIAM COOPER, 30s, sits at a desk, tearing open a manil envelope with latex gloves. He wears a conservative suit and tie, but his haircut and bearing are those of a soldier. Pulling out several 8x10 black and white photos, he drops them on the desk: they're of a man and woman in a tryst.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Cooper takes out a sheet of plastic with a dozen blonde hairs pressed onto it.  16. Lifting them one by one with tweezers, he places them on a brush, in the shower drain, in the dust on the floor. As his phone VIBRATES, he checks the number and answers.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Hey hon. He takes out plastic sheets with individual fingerprints pressed into them. Laying one on the corner of the mirror, he peels back the plastic, leaving the print. COOPER (cont'd) No I think I'll be on time tonight.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Cooper walks past someone struggling to maintain his precarious tip-toe balance on a chair, his hands secured behind his back and his neck in a noose. COOPER (cont'd) Okay, well I'll talk to the boys about it when I get home.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Cooper lays fingerprints on the left side of the bed and nightstand. COOPER (cont'd) I will. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Cooper walks back in. COOPER (cont'd) Okay. Love you. Bye. Desperate, the MAN from the tryst photos tries to look down at Cooper while keeping balanced. He's 50s, heavyset but well groomed, wearing a suit that cost thousands.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (Eastern European accent) Listen. I can make you rich. Cooper ignores him, making a note on his PDA. MAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: KNOW WHO I AM
dialogues.text: Cooper glances up with no reaction.  17.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Actually, I don't have the slightest idea. He kicks the chair out from under him. Legs dance wildly in the air behind Cooper as his phone buzzes again. He checks the text: "FRANKLIN SQ. 10 MIN." The legs still. Cooper removes the padded restraints from the wrists of the dead man and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least that's the sign. But there's no green. Just cracked pink stucco as far as the eye can see. SUPERED TITLE: WASHINGTON, D.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOE MATHESON sits in a wheelchair in his small one-room apartment, struggling to reach the rabbit ears of a tiny crap TV. Joe's a man from another era - 90s and frail - but his white hair is neatly parted and slicked back, and he wear a three-piece suit with a gold chain and pocket-watch. Smacking the side of the television, he shakes it, making a hell of a racket until...

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Is that thing acting up again? Joe glances back and smiles at the cute NURSE in his doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can you give it a shot Marna?

dialogues.speaker: MARNA
dialogues.text: Of course. He rolls out of her way and settles in to watch as she's forced to lean way over to reach the antennas. MARNA (cont'd) I don't see why you don't move these lower. He admires her ass.  18.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Better picture. Try a little to the left. (beat) That's getting there. REVEAL Frank stepping into the doorway, taking in the scene. He clears his throat. Joe looks over as the nurse straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: MARNA
dialogues.text: Well, I think that does it Mr. Matheson. She walks out, placing a hand on Joe's arm as she passes. MARNA (cont'd) See you later.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Thanks Marna. Frank watches her go, marveling.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable. Joe grins devilishly, struggling to his feet and pulling Frank into a huge hug.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Your timing is terrible, Kid. I don't see you in forever and when you finally show, you're cutting into my action.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is that why you're always telling me not to come? Frank helps him sit back down.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: It's goddamned embarrassing you seeing me like this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Who do you think you're talking to, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: I never thought it would happen to me. Getting old. The things we did, I never thought I'd still be alive. Hell, I can't believe you're alive.  19.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I retired.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: You? Ha! Can't be. I remember recruiting this wet-behind-the-ears army punk like it was yesterday. Frank can't help but smile. JOE (cont'd) What'd you do? Marry the girl next door? Frank hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Sarah lies on the bed, mouth taped, hands and feet tied to the bed frame, furiously struggling to get loose.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Not exactly. (beat) I got a visit from a wet team last night.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (stunned) Jesus. How'd that go?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You have someone you trust in the Company who can run some IDs?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Sure. Got the prints? Frank tosses him a squishy plastic bag. Joe peers inside, disgusted. JOE (cont'd) You know there was a time this was a gentleman's game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moms walk babies, a pack of kids kicks around a soccer ball, and parents casually watch the action.  20. Cooper walks along the edge of the game, stopping beside a heavy, balding MAN, 50s, in a conservative suit holding a newspaper. They both watch the soccer game.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: We had an action go south. I need you to clean it up. He hands Cooper the newspaper. MAN (cont'd) This is from the top. It's off the books. Total blackout. No logs. No records. Are we clear?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Cooper opens the newspaper, revealing a file. The first page is a long-lensed photograph of Frank watering his roses.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: That's your primary target. There was a previous team. They are dead. Cooper flips through the file, reading.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: He was CIA.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Is that a problem? Cooper closes the file and tucks the paper under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Frank sit on a small patio in the shade. Joe's on a cell phone taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Okay. You too. Thanks. He hangs up. JOE (cont'd) It was a South African team. Very elite. They only worked for major governments.  Joe gives He passes 21.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Christ. him a hard look.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: What the hell did you do?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Nothing! I'm out! I've been sitting on my ass killing roses.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: One of them is also a print match to an NYPD crime scene. A woman was killed a couple months back. his notes to Frank, but nothing clicks.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don't know her. ___(angry) This doesn't make any sense. Who would come after me now?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Give me a day. I'll make some calls. See what I can find out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just be careful. These guys are motivated.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Hell, Kid. I'm ninety years old with stage IV liver cancer. What do I have to be afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cramped high-tech nerve center is filled with computers, data and video feeds. THOMAS and JACKSON, 30, cold and hard, stand with Cooper, sorting through the detritus of Frank's life spread out on tables: phone bills, mail, trash, receipts...

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: In six months this guy didn't make a single personal phone call. No credit cards, no voicemail, no computer, no TV.  22.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Run the ten pay phones closest to his house. A phone RINGS and Thomas grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah? (to Cooper) D.C. Metro's responding to a 911 call from one Sarah Ross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three police cruisers and an ambulance are out front, lights flashing. POLICE OFFICERS have cordoned off the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits on the tailgate being checked out by a PARAMED as a YOUNG COP stands protectively beside her. She's stressed out and shaken.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I need to call my family.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Just finishing up. He strips the blood pressure cuff and the cop helps her u

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogues.text: We'll get you a phone, but they want me to take you downtown for a statement. There's also a bunch of federal guys who want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Is this going to take long? He grins.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah follows the cop around the corner to his cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey!  23. An older, PLAINCLOTHES DETECTIVE, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: PLAINCLOTHES DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Where are you taking her?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogues.text: (confused) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PARKING STRUCTURE ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Cooper looks down from the rooftop, watching the two cops through binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: (into headset) Take him out.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The detective's startled as, PFFT! PFFT! he takes two in the chest from a SILENCED PISTOL in the young cop's hand. Stunned, Sarah backs away, but he grabs her, jabbing a hypodermic into her arm.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No! He pops the trunk of the cruiser, forcing her inside... ...but suddenly the cop's grabbed from behind. CRUNCH! He falls... ...revealing Frank. Sarah woozily stares at him and then the two dead bodies. SARAH (cont'd) You just killed that man?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yes. He pulls open the syringe and tastes what's inside.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Am I going to die?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just sleep. You probably need it. He helps her into the passenger side of the cruiser.  24.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I am very tired. Sliding behind the wheel he pulls out. Sarah leans against him, watching the world slide by with heavy lids. SARAH (cont'd) Frank?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is just like in Love's Savage Secret, where the tennis pro saves her from the Jihadists. ...and she's out.

dialogues.speaker: MPH SENDING BOTH CARS SPINNING IN A SHOWER OF GLASS.
dialogues.text: Opening his door for cover, Cooper's unloading rounds into Frank's police cruiser. But as he whips out his magazine and reloads, Frank pops back up behind the wheel, peeling out in shriek of burnin rubber and twisted metal. Cooper tracks the cruiser, FIRING until it disappears around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving with one hand, Frank's on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Shots fired! Officer down! sth and Douglas! Suspect is a white male, 30's, dark suit, white shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the car, Cooper punches it, peeling around the corner after Frank, accelerating fast, but then abruptly SCREECHING to a stop. Frank's cruiser is parked on the street. Jumping from his car, gun ready, Cooper approaches, angli around to see inside... it's empty.  25. Taking his time, Cooper surveys the scene: Frank's car hissing coolant; a dead-empty street of small businesses. Whipping up his gun at motion, Cooper looks down his sigh at a CLERK in the flower shop in front of him, staring at him in wide-eyed fear through the open door. On both sides of Cooper, police cars turn onto the street screeching to a halt 100 feet back and spilling out cops. CoP Drop your weapon! Cooper weighs his options. Then he puts down the gun and raises his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping into sight with Sarah unconscious in one arm, Frank moves his .45 from the clerk to cover Cooper. The two men stare each other down.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to the clerk) Out the back. Car keys. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Matheson's on the phone, worried, jotting something on a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: I appreciate it. Okay. Bye. He folds the paper and scrawls Frank's name on it. Rolling to his dressing table, Joe straightens his tie, combs his hair back, and picks up his wallet and keys. Behind him, the door to his room opens and two men in suits step inside, pulling the door shut. Joe coldly eyes them in the mirror, slipping the paper into the dresser. One SUIT takes out a gun. The other picks up a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: So it's like that then?

dialogues.speaker: SUIT
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's like that. Joe nods, resigned.  26.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERED TITLE
dialogues.text: Frank sits in an SUV parked in front of an apartment building, sipping coffee. Across the river are the skyscrapers of Manhattan. Sarah stirs, waking in the passenger seat beside him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey. She looks around, disoriented and panicky. FRANK (cont'd) Take it easy. You're okay. Off balance, she tries to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How... (beat) How long was I asleep?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: About six hours. Coffee? She nervously looks him over and takes it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Thanks. (beat) Thanks for saving me. He nods. She takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How'd you get free?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I worked the headboard loose and burned through the rope with the heater's pilot light. Frank's impressed. SARAH (cont'd) I'm sorry I didn't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I tied you up. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Who's doing this?  27.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don't know. She's having trouble grasping it all.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to have dinner with my parents tonight.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You're not going to make it. And if you call them, they're going to get hurt. Do you understand? She nods, unnerved by his intensity.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What happens now?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The men who came after me killed the daughter of a woman who lives in that building. I'm hoping we can figure out the connection. She considers this.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I guess you're going to be stuck with me for a while. Frank looks at her in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sarah absently picks a piece of car safety glass out of her hair and looks questioningly at Frank. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Sarah stop at number 2D.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: One sec. He opens his satchel and grabs the duct tape. FRANK (cont'd) Hold this. Then he takes out a drug bottle and fills a syringe, tapping out the bubbles.  28.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What are you doing? I thought we were going to talk to her!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We are. This'll just help.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The woman lost her daughter! She grabs the syringe. SARAH (cont'd) People are basically nice, Frank. She knocks on the door. He looks at her sourly.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That hasn't been my experience.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think maybe I should do the talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Frank sit on the sofa opposite MRS. CHAN, 60, who hands Sarah a photo of her smiling 30ish daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CHAN
dialogues.text: She gave me this picture the week before she died. It was the last time I saw her... The police said it was just a burglary. Sarah puts a sympathetic hand on her arm.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We don't know it was anything other than that. You said Stephanie was a reporter? Mrs. Chan nods, choked up. SARAH (cont'd) Do you know what she was working on?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CHAN
dialogues.text: No. Sarah notices writing on the back of the photo: a cross followed by 1980 1745 126.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What's this number?  29.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CHAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's Stephanie's writing. I tried dialing it. The police had no idea. Frank stares at the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Sarah walk through the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's a dead drop. That code is a call number for a book.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Call numbers start with letters.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Library of Congress does. Harvard- Yenching is a system for Asian language books. 1980 is the number for Christian literature: the cross.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How could you possibly know that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Wo zhu zai Zhongguo ji nian qian.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Christ. You speak Chinese?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I was there for a few years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Studying call numbers, Frank pulls a book from the shelf, and opens it. Inside is a single sheet of paper: a typed list of almost twenty names.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. One of them is "FRANK MOSES." SARAH (cont'd) What is this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don't know.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits at a terminal with the list between them.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hank Maestriano... died two weeks ago in a car crash. Daniel McGinty, heart attack last week. Aaron Burke... suicide four days ago.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Jesus. It's a hit list. Pulling out a cell phone, he quickly dials.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This one guy is still alive, I think. Gabriel Loeb. He flies cargo planes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (into phone) Who is this? (pause) Marna? Where's Joe?

dialogues.speaker: INT. ASSISTED LIVING FACILITY
dialogues.text: Joe's nurse MARNA stands shaken and stammering. Behind her, Joe's apartment is swarming with cops.

dialogues.speaker: MARNA
dialogues.text: Mr. Moses?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MARNA
dialogues.text: Mr. Matheson has disappeared. There's... there's blood everywhere. She silently breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Looks like two shooters... Frank's reeling.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: MARNA
dialogues.text: They found a note with your name on it. He talked about you all the time. He loved you like a son.  31.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Marna. What did it say?

dialogues.speaker: MARNA
dialogues.text: It was just two words. (beat) The Company. Frank hangs up, stunned. He's beside himself.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Joe's dead. She reaches out to him, but he gets up. He's cold with fury, stirred to the core of his being. FRANK (cont'd) Those bastards are going to pay.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: SUPERED TITLE
dialogues.text: Striding across the seal of the Central Intelligence Agen set into the polished marble floor... ...is Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stands with Frank's file across from a RESEARCH CLERK at a computer.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: This man is NOT a retired Asian block analyst who's been out of the field for thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH CLERK
dialogues.text: That's what it says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards check Cooper's paperwork, then nod to an old RECORDS KEEPER. The old man dials in a combination and the guards swing open a huge steel door, revealing a cavernous file room.  32.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDS KEEPER
dialogues.text: These records have never been computerized. They never will be.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERED TITLE
dialogues.text: Frank moves through the throngs of people exiting the terminal, accidentally bumping into a woman in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Pressing on, he flips through the pocketbook of the woman he just bumped. Reaching Sarah in line at the ticket counter, he hands her a driver's license that looks remarkably like her. FRANK (cont'd) Cynthia Bolt. Memorize the date of birth.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Will you tell me where we're going now?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: To see Marvin. Confused, Sarah takes out the list, finding the name.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Marvin Frye?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He's the only name on that list I know. We worked together before he sectioned out. He knows things.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Frank, he died two years ago ina fire.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He's died before.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Marvin's... peculiar. Extremely paranoid and dangerous. He's not like other people.  33.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're not like other people. Frank considers. It's a fair point.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Right. Well, Marvin's less like other people. A TICKET AGENT waves them over.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET AGENT
dialogues.text: I'm sorry things are so slow, our computers are down. Someone spilled coffee on the server. Frank takes the last sip of a jumbo java.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper drops a six-inch-thick stack of paper stamped "TOP SECRET" onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Frank Moses's real file. Thomas flips it open. Page after page has been blacked out, line by line.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: Is this a joke? They finally get to bits of text here and there:

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: This guy's got to be one of the best black ops agent we ever had. He's offed drug-lords, terrorists, heads of state. He's toppled governments.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: Jesus. An ALARM from one of the computers sends Thomas back to check his system.  34.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I've got a ticket to Rio on Sarah Ross's credit card. They've been in the air three hours.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Three hours?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: It looks like someone um... destroyed the airline's airport server. Cooper digests this, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: He's running.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: He's not running.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: He knows we're going to be hard pressed to have someone there before him.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Does this look like the file of someone who's going to rabbit? It's a dodge. (beat) I get this guy. He's good. But he's old school. Cloak and dagger crap. He hardly knows how to use a computer.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: He knows how to wreck one. Cooper shoots him a hard look, thinking it over.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: If we hurt the woman's parents, do you think it will draw him out? This catches Thomas off guard.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I... don't know.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Put them under surveillance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Sarah exit a terminal.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Car rental?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Long term parking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Sarah step into the street in the "LONG TERM PARKING" lot. A GUY in a JEEP screeches to a halt and HONKS.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Move it!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We're in a crosswalk! The guy leans on his HORN and REVS his engine. Sarah jumps out of the way, but Frank just stands there, looking over the Jeep and its mullet-sporting driver.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Chop chop, Grandpa! Frank steps to the driver's side window. GUY (cont'd) What? You wanna go?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is this thing 4-wheel drive?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Hell yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank slams the trunk of a parked car on the duct-taped guy, climbs into the JEEP, smiles at Sarah and pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading south, Frank and Sarah are waved through to Mexic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bouncing along this dirt road with the sun setting behind them, it feels a million miles from anywhere.  36. Up ahead, a walled compound rises out of the desert mesa.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: When we get there, don't make any sudden movements. Don't ask to use a phone. In fact, don't even talk about phones. Or satellites. Sarah stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're serious?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah, why? Driving up to the front gate, they pull to a stop. FRANK (cont'd) (calling out) Hello? A little Mexican kid appears, pulling open the gate and excitedly waving them into the courtyard. Frank pulls forward... ...and suddenly the ground gives way and the entire Jeep collapses into a pit trap. Frank's instantly out the roof of the car, jumping clear. ...but as he hits the ground a FIGURE IN DESERT CAMO burs from a spider hole, leveling an assault rifle at Frank's head, screaming...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Jesus, Marvin! It's Frank!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm not!

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: You are! As Marvin's finger tightens on the trigger Frank lashes out, pulling the barrel past him and the fight is on. Marvin throws two quick punches, connecting hard, but Frank counters, sweeping a leg, and they land in a heap with Frank's .45 in Marvin's face.  37.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Because the last time we met, I tried to kill you. Frank considers.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That was a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: You sure? Some people hold onto a thing like that.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I am NOT trying to kill you! Marvin thinks it over and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So get your knife out of my balls! REVEAL Marvin has a blade pressed to Frank's crotch. They slowly lower their weapons. Marvin helps Frank up, dusting him off. He's older than Frank, weathered, with wild hair and bright eyes. Reaching into the pit, Frank helps Sarah out of the car. FRANK (cont'd) Sarah, this is Marvin Frye. Marvin, she's okay. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hello. Marvin eyes her with suspicion, then abruptly turns and starts out the front gate, walking into the desert.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Come on. I'll show you the house. Frank glances back at the beautiful hacienda behind them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What's that? Marvin doesn't even turn around.  38.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: The decoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door in the ceiling opens and harsh sunlight breaks the darkness, revealing stairs running down cast concrete wal Marvin, Sarah and Frank make their way into the utilitari bunker, past barrels of water and fuel, MREs and dry good

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why do you live in a bunker when you have that other place?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I moved out last year after that helicopter flew by. (leaning close) I could feel their eyes on me, wet, like peaches. Sarah glances wide-eyed at Frank, but he waves her off with a "don't go there" gesture. Marvin leads them into the "living room," smiling geniall MARVIN (cont'd) So let me see this list. Frank hands it over as Sarah glances around uneasily at the ratty chairs and dozens of racks of firearms, crates of C-4, grenade launchers, and Stinger missiles.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Everyone on it's dead except for us and one other guy. I can't figure out the connection. Marvin paces as he studies the list, growing more and more agitated.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I always told you, Frank, you can't trust the system. You can't be a part of it, because then, the minute they flip the switch, you're done. The satellites, man, the cell phones, the chips, the net... Marvin drifts off, staring at nothing. Frank and Sarah exchange a look worried look.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Marvin.  39.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The list. I need your help. Marvin looks at him, then back at the list, completely unaware of any break in continuity.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Let me check the files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steel door CREAKS open revealing a room that looks like the physical embodiment of a madman's mind. Towers of papers, clippings, scrawled notes, and typed summaries fill the room, floor to ceiling, flagged with color codes and numbers in some insane indexing system.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's gotten bigger.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: This may take a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks back in. Sarah chases after him, eyeing the aluminum foil taped to the bunker's ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (whisper ) Frank. This guy's insane!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I told you: he sectioned out.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to know what that means?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Trust me, Marvin's the guy you want watching your back when everything goes to hell.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He said he tried to kill you!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I always felt bad about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He thought he was the subject of a secret government mind control experiment. I told him he was nuts. He thought I was in on it and tried to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah, but later I found out they were actually dosing him with LSD for a decade. Marvin walks back in with a stack of papers, Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Afghanistan. Fall of '81 near Ghazni. At least four of these guys were there, not including us. Frank thinks back, remembering. He looks at

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (hesitates) We were way out in the sticks and 40. startling Marvin. got called to meet this ISA Captain.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: McGinty. He's on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Mujahideen fighters walk along a rocky path into a narrow valley. On closer view, we see it's Frank and Marvin. and stare, sickened.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Holy Christ.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was a village. Bloodied bodies lie everywhere. Men. Women. Animals. They stop Children.  41. Flies BUZZ obscenely. FRANK (V.0.) (cont'd) There were no military targets there. It was a massacre. Marvin examines a spent shell and tosses it to Frank. They exchange a concerned look. Stepping over bodies, they approach Special Forces CAPTAI McGINTY waiting for them beside a CIVILIAN, 30s, who incongruously wears a short-sleeved button-down.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: What the hell happened here? But the civilian steps in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: CIVILIAN
dialogues.text: Your orders are to make this disappear. Bury the bodies. Burn everything else. Pick up every piece of American brass. This never happened. Frank just stares at the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares at Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You think everyone on this list was involved? Marvin shrugs, flipping through military records.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Even if there was some massacre, why do they want to kill you now?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: You sure it's the CIA? Frank nods. Marvin paces, getting more and more worked up. MARVIN (cont'd) Dammit. DAMMIT! (beat) You know what's WRONG with this government -- with these Patriot Act wiretapping, preemptive war (more)  A beat as 42. MARVIN (cont'd) starting, extreme renditioning, fear-mongering War on Terror bastards?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: They're trying to kill us?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Exactly! Frank waits for more.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's why we're here, Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Well we've got to do something. (beat ) Who else on this list is still alive?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Gabriel Loeb.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Lock and load, baby! It's on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud cars, thick pollution, and crowds of locals selling trinkets to crowds of American tourists fill the street.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERED TITLE
dialogues.text: Frank and Marvin sit in the shade, eating popsicles and watching Sarah talk on a pay phone across the street.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: (agitated) What if they've tapped every data source that exists on this Loeb guy and are backtracing every connection that comes in on those sources and somehow filter those millions of calls and know it's us and then tag us with a chemical marker, or put a satellite on us, or fry us with Y-rays? Frank thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Even for you that's pretty paranoid.  43.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I guess. Marvin glances up at the sky, then pulls out a tattered napkin and makes some urgent notes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: (defensive) Nothing. Sarah hangs up and heads over. MARVIN (cont'd) What's with the girl, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I like her.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: No seriously. What's the angle? Frank lets it go as Sarah walks up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Loeb is coming into San Antonio. We can meet him at the Air Freight terminal. It's his first return to the country in four weeks. Marvin looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: How do you want to cross the border?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Discreetly.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERED TITLE
dialogues.text: A group of noisy SENIOR TOURISTS carrying tons of cheap Juarez tourist crap disembark from a tour bus. Among them are Frank, wearing a serape, Sarah with a pig pifiata, and Marvin sporting a sombrero. A drunk OLD LADY swigs from a beer, singing at Marvin...

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: La cucaracha, la cucaracha, ya no puede caminar...  44.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Next time lets just hijack someone or blow something up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Next time I get the serape.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I always get the serape.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: He does. Walking away, Frank and Sarah head to a taxi stand and look around for a cab.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh no! Oh God! Please don't... Frank and Sarah spin, stunned to see... Marvin, holding a gun to the head of a BUSINESSWOMAN, dragging her into an alley.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSWOMAN
dialogues.text: (terrified) Coldwell Banker! I'ma real estate agent! Just take the money. Please don't hurt me! Furious at the lie, Marvin cocks the pistol, putting it to her eye, sending the woman erupting into tears as Fran and Sarah burst around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Marvin! What are you...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: One of who?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: SHE WAS FOLLOWING US, MAN! She's got a camera hidden in her purse. (matter of fact) We have to kill her.  45.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (sobbing) No... please... Marvin holds up his left hand to block the splatter...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Frank!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just hold on! He grabs the woman's purse and dumps the contents onto the ground: there's a wallet, cosmetics, a cell phone. Frank rips the purse apart: there's nothing. FRANK (cont'd) (annoyed) Where's the camera, Marvin? Marvin hesitates, suddenly unsure.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: She was... following us. Frank pushes down the barrel of Marvin's gun and snaps the woman's cell phone in half.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to the woman) Go. She runs off. Frank gives Marvin a hard look. FRANK (cont'd) Go get us a car. And don't kill anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Frank watch a 747 cargo jet pull to a stop on the tarmac and power down. Marvin's in the background with the pifiata, absentminded scratching it behind the ears. Sarah's quiet. Angry.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Are you upset?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: "She's got a camera hidden in her purse. We have to kill her." Are you kidding me?  46.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Everyone makes mistakes. He stands, cutting off Sarah's retort as three PILOTS enter the terminal. FRANK (cont'd) Gabriel Loeb? The oldest pilot looks over. He's Frank's age with that classic ex-military look: tight haircut, thin, good shape The other two pilots pause as well, but Gabriel nods to them to go on ahead. FRANK (cont'd) You have a minute?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: (Texas twang) What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Afghanistan. 1981. Near Ghazni. There's a tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: I can't talk to you. He pushes past, but Marvin steps in front of him. In a flash, Gabriel has a knife in his hand. Marvin and Frank both draw guns. Gabriel smiles. GABRIEL (cont'd) Pair beats ace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk Gabriel into this second story windowed office looking out over the airfield. Marvin circles the room, looking out the windows.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You fellas hear the one about what the West Texas Jew-boy twice- decorated Marine pilot said to the Chinese New York Times reporter?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What?  47.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Nothing! I didn't tell her a damned thing! Frank looks at him coldly.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: She's dead. And everyone on her list is dead except for you, me, and him. The CIA has targeted everyone who was there. Gabriel's stunned.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Oh Christ. Frank stares at him realizing...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You know why... Gabriel sits down heavily, unable to look at him. FRANK (cont'd) Tell me. He glances up with fear and resignation.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: They had me fly this guy out there from the gulf. Middle of the night. Hairy little airstrip in the middle of nowhere. He picked up a package and we flew back out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Who was the guy? Over by the windows, Marvin starts MUTTERING as he fidget with his tattered napkin. Sarah glances over nervously.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: CIA. Dorky little spook in short sleeves straight out of some office. The whole thing was super hush hush.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What about the package?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Frank! Frank! Frank

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (annoyed) What?  48. Marvin runs over, pointing out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: A helicopter!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We're at an airport for Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Two four seven seven one. It's following us. I write down all the numbers, see? Frank stares at Marvin, then looks at the tattered napkin filled with dozens of rows of tiny, smeared numbers. He squints at the chopper then back at the napkin.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That's a four.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: It's a seven!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Who makes a seven like that?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Let me see it. Suddenly the window SPIDERWEBS. Sarah looks around, startled.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Whoa! What was...? She realizes Frank, Marvin and Gabriel are on the floor. Frank pulls her down as... WHUMP! A bullet hits the wall where she was standing. Gabriel lies motionless, blood on his shirt. SARAH (cont'd) Oh my God! Frank checks him. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I knew we shouldn't have used that phone!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Shut up, Marvin!  49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper listens in on a comm set as he watches a LONG-LENS VIDEO FEED of the unfolding action with Thomas and Jackso

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: One target down. I have no visual.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Fire for effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire FLASH-FRAMES the SILENT footage as the shooter unloads, bullets chewing up the windows of the building. Frank runs low and fast through the air cargo office, dragging Sarah after him as she holds onto the pifiata.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Targets exiting south side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Sarah and Marvin burst into this warehouse alley. Suddenly someone steps around the corner up ahead with an assault rifle, firing. It's the "businesswoman" Marvin grabbed earlier. They dive behind a dumpster, bullets SLAMMING all around.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSWOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm going to fuck you up, old man! Marvin gives Frank a look.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Can I kill her now? Together as one, they swing around opposite sides of the dumpster to fire... But she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Move! Marvin covers the rear as Frank pushes Sarah up the alley  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly their flight is interrupted as BULLETS RAIN DOWN from a ROOFTOP SHOOTER, sending all three diving for cove behind a scissor lift.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (re: pifiata) Give me the pig. Sarah hands it over and... WHACK! Frank punches in the side, pulling out extra magazines. Marvin reaches in, coming up with a machine pistol.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Old man? I'm in my prime! Frank scoffs. Pissed, Marvin jacks a cartridge out of his gun, catches it in the air and holds it out. MARVIN (cont'd) Bet you can't take this bullet out of my hand. More bullets SLAM around them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Not now, Marvin!

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Bet you can't. Quick as a flash, Sarah grabs the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Can we go now! Marvin is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: WAIT! I wasn't ready. Do it again. Under a barrage of lead, Frank leans around the scissor lift, takes his time, and fires a single shot, ending the incoming fire. Suddenly BLAM BLAM BLAM... bullets fly out of the wall, beside them, just missing. Stunned, Frank and Marvin FIRE BACK THROUGH THE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aaaagh!  51.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How the hell...?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Satellites. He looks up at the sky and flips it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper watches the big screen which has up a satellite picture of the area with red thermal signatures of the people on the ground, including Marvin and his finger.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Two men down. Jackson sees something on screen.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: Hold on, this is going to be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far end of the alley, the "businesswoman" steps around the corner with a shoulder-mounted rocket.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That's not good. Frank grabs her, running all-out down the alley. FFFSST! KABOOM! The scissor-lift explodes like a toy. Frank and Sarah are thrown to the ground by the blast. Reloading, the woman levels the launcher again at the prone figures. But suddenly Marvin steps from the burning debris, standi his ground, facing her down like a gunfighter. The woman's finger tightens on the trigger... And in a single clean motion, Marvin raises his pistol and fires. KA-BOOOM! A massive explosion rocks the alley as his bullet detonates the rocket. As debris rains down on Frank and Sarah, a figure appears above them. It's Marvin, reaching down to help them up.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Old man, my ass.  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at the big screen, washed out by the thermals and smoke.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: I can't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Get someone in there. I want to see bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A food service truck drives away from the airport as a string of emergency vehicles speeds the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin sleeps in the cab as Frank stands with Sarah at the side of the road, holding back her hair as she throws up in the tall grass.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I told you excitement was overrated. (beat ) You okay? She nods, then hurls again. FRANK (cont'd) It happens to everybody in the beginning. Frank looks over at Marvin who cracks one eye and taps his watch impatiently. Frank shrugs helplessly. Finally Sarah straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You sure know how to show a girl a good time. Are all your first dates like this? Frank's a deer in the headlights.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I uh... haven't dated much.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits beside Marvin, who chuckles to himself as they roll through the night.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: (mimicking Frank) I uh... haven't dated much. Frank glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don't make me shoot you. Marvin is positively gleeful.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: It's okay, man. She likes you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Notice how she's sticking around. Women don't do that if they don't like you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: She doesn't have a lot of choice.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Sure she does. Frank glances up at the far end of the car, watching Sara enter and make her way towards them. MARVIN (cont'd) They know we know about the list now. They're going to keep coming. Frank considers.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: There's only one way we're going to find out what this is really about. Marvin weighs it.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: It's impossible. We'll get killed for sure.  54.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So you're in?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Of course I'm in. I was just saying. Arriving beside Frank and Marvin, Sarah hands out candy to the fellas. She looks between them.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's behind the wheel, Sarah's in front, and Marvin's in back as they roll past the mall.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: If we're going to pull this off, we're going to need help.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Pull what off? Frank stops across from a large compound. Marvin freaks.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: No way! Not them!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Who? Marvin jumps out of the car. Resigned, Frank gets out. Sarah follows and sees the sign: RUSSIAN FEDERATION EMBAS

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Godless bastards! He runs off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Marvin tends to be ruled by his emotions, but sometimes you need to think outside the box.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're not really going in there?  55. Frank takes out his .45 and the dog tags he retrieved from his basement.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hold these. (beat) In case I don't come back. She stares at him stunned. Frank presses them into her hands. For a long moment neither of them moves. Then Frank turns away, starting up the street.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. He turns back and she's right there. Reaching up on tiptoes, she gives him a kiss on the cheek SARAH (cont'd) Be careful. He looks at her for a long beat, then turns, walking past the main gates, stopping at an unmarked steel door. Pressing an intercom button, he looks up at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Tell Ivan Siderov that Frank Moses is here to see him. There's no response. Up the street, Sarah stands in the shadows watching. Suddenly the door bursts open and four soldiers are leveling AK-47s at Frank. They expertly force him to kneel, pat him down, then roughly drag him inside. The last soldier stands in the doorway, rifle aimed at Sarah. She stands frozen, unable to breathe... ...and then he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IVAN SIDEROV, a rumpled old man, sits behind a large desk wearing a permanent expression of Russian pain and dissatisfaction, along with an expensively tailored suit that still manages to look like it doesn't fit.  56. Cleaning his nails, he doesn't even look up as Frank is dragged into the room and stuffed into a chair across from him.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Leave us. The soldiers look at him in surprise. He doesn't repeat himself, but raises his eyes to them and they file out. IVAN (cont'd) (heavy Russian accent) I have to say, this is not something I expected when I got up this morning. Ivan pulls a vodka bottle from a drawer, pours two, and slides one across the desk. He raises his glass. IVAN (cont'd) It is good to meet you. In person. They clink and drink.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Do you kind of want to shoot me? Ivan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Little bit. I used to dream about it. Like I dream about good coffee or sunshine during winter. But now, what's the point? You are retired, yes?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yes. Ivan looks off.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Still, I feel I owe you for killing Semyon.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The Butcher?

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: A great asset. Did you know he was my cousin?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (a beat) No.  57.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: (raising his glass) To Semyon the Butcher. Frank toasts and drinks. Then...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He's not actually dead. Ivan stares at Frank. FRANK (cont'd) I flipped him.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Now he owns a bunch of 7-11s. Ivan looks at him, stunned. Frank smiles.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Bastard.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm sure you've heard worse. Ivan fills Frank's glass.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: I pour you double.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Veronique: that girl in Paris in "81. She was mine.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Da!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Yes! He thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Whatever she got, it was worth it.  58. They raise glasses and drink again. Ivan sits back.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: I miss the old days. We could swing at each other like men. Now it's economic leverage and political posturing. I haven't had someone killed in years. Frank nods in sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What can you do?

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: And don't get me started on the puppies they send me to train now: too smart for their own good without a gram of sense among them. Ivan fills the glasses again. IVAN (cont'd) So. (beat ) I think that you are not here for the hospitality. There's a pregnant beat.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm going to break into the CIA. I need your complete security package on Langley: plans, schedules, cracks, IDs, all of it. Ivan stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Why would you possibly think I have that sort of information? There's a tense beat. Then they both chuckle. IVAN (cont'd) Why do this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Personal project. Like a hobby. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Have you tried gardening?  59.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Didn't work out.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: I can't stand it either. If it's not bugs, it's the damned fungus.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You try soapy water?

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Does that work?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So I hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah paces back and forth in the shadows across the stre from the main gate, alone, sick with worry. She starts towards the Embassy, but then stops, changes her mind, and doubles back.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I told you everything was going to be all right. She whips around as he appears from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No you didn't! You said, "Hold these in case I don't come back."

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So you were worried about me? Now she's embarrassed. She punches him in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Jerk. Frank smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Let's go find Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Nestled on lush grounds, the old CIA headquarters buildin stands flanked by the two new massive six-story buildings where thousands of people come to work each day. The sprawling compound looks more like a college campus than the epicenter of American foreign intelligence.  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A towncar pulls up. Marvin gets out and opens the door for Frank and Sarah, who exit wearing suits and CIA badge As the two of them walk toward one of the towers, Sarah looks like she's going to be sick.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just relax and smile. I'll get us inside, you'll just pull their files.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I'm not a hacker.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's a closed system. The trick is getting to the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Sarah enter and make their way through the huge four-story atrium, towards the high-security elevators. An armed guard looks them over. Sarah forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What makes you think the Russians wouldn't sell you down the river?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Ivan and I come from a world where enemies can still have ethics. I guess you could say, I have faith.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Faith? Frank hands Sarah a small case and punches the elevator button.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Actually it's more like hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping inside, Frank punches in a security code and the button for the 5th floor. The door slides closed and the wall-mounted retinal scann lights up as Sarah opens the case, removing a single gold contact lens, laser-etched with an elaborate pattern.  61. Frank bends close and she puts the contact...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I dropped it. Frank looks at her stunned.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I dropped it!

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Scan incomplete. They both drop to the floor, frantically searching.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Gently.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Dammit...

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Scan incomplete.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don't know how long... An ALARM suddenly sounds.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh God, oh God... The doors roll open and THREE SECURITY OFFICERS stand ready, hands on their weapons, looking down at Frank and Sarah on all fours. There's a seriously awkward beat. SARAH (cont'd) The General dropped his contact. Frank looks at her in disbelief. SARAH (cont'd) (annoyed) Well? Aren't you going to give him a hand? Frank watches stunned as the security officers quickly join them on all fours, searching the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Got it!  62. He holds up the contact to the light, looking closely... ...but Sarah snatches it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Here, sir. Quickly cleaning it, she gently lays it in Frank's eye. The lead security officer turns a key in the elevator, and Frank leans forward to have his eye scanned.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Scan complete. The lights go green.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Have a good day, sir. Frank nods and the doors roll closed.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don't begin to know what to say about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank leads Sarah to a heavy steel door with an elaborate electronic number pad/scanner beside it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Is this it? Frank nods.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Did you know these locks cost eighty- five thousand dollars each?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. He pulls out a matt knife and cuts a hole in the drywall beside the door, then reaches in and opens the handle.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: God love forced low-bid government contracts. He tapes a single sheet of paper over the hole in the wall: "SECURITY IS EVERYONE'S BUSINESS." Pushing open the door reveals a small, high-tech room with a lone computer terminal.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits at the computer with Frank behind her, watchin her fly through files and directories.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What do you think the punishment is for what we're doing?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Depending on what they charge you with, either life in prison or death.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
