dialogues.text: Awesome. She brings up the profile for the killer dressed as a young cop who tried to grab her at the motel. SARAH (cont'd) There.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Work the assignment tree back and see if you can find the executive. A few keystrokes later, she brings up Cooper's photograph and profile. FRANK (cont'd) I want everything on this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas stares at his computer, flipping out.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Someone's tripping flags in the system. They're all over our players! Cooper's at his side in a second.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Who is it? Thomas looks from his screen in confusion...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: It's internal. Directorate on five. Cooper hustles across the room and grabs a phone.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: We have a breach on five.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! SIX TACTICAL BADASSES in body armor burst into the secure server room leveling weapons. Sarah whips around..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Frank kicks open the door, bursting inside. Thomas makes it to his feet before his face is bounced into the desk and he hits the floor unconscious. Frank looks at Cooper across the room, still on the phone

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You. Cooper stares. He almost laughs.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. Frank closes in on him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What did they pull out of Afghanistan?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You think you can just walk in here and everyone'll just roll over?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Actually, I figured I'd have to beat it out of some snot-nosed button-pusher. Frank swings on him, but Cooper blocks and counters. In a flurry of fists, Frank is hit once and then again. Face bloodied, he stumbles back, stunned. Cooper smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Not quite as fast as you once were? Frank spits blood.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Kordesky trained you?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Yeah.  65. Cooper closes again, attacks, blocks, and delivers two more brutal body-blows... ...but suddenly Frank spins around him, catching an arm and slamming Cooper onto a desk, pinned.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I taught Kordesky. Frank brutally twists his arm, tighter.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Who ordered these hits? Cooper glares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Orders come, you execute. You of all people should know how it works. CRACK! Frank breaks his arm. COOPER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You come after one of your own and you don't even ask why?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: It doesn't come to me unless it's been vetted all the way up the line. There's not a doubt in my mind you've earned what you've got coming. Frank grabs his chin, cranking his neck to the edge of breaking.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The minute you learned who I was you should have walked away. Gasping, Cooper wrenches out a reply.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Would you? Suddenly wrenching to his left, Cooper slides off the desk, hitting the floor, catching Frank by surprise with a kick, knocking him down. Jumping up, Cooper grabs a phone with his good arm, clobbering Frank...  66. ...but Frank kicks him, catching Cooper in the gut, sendi him flying backwards through the glass wall of his office Frank's up in a second, but Cooper's in his desk, coming up with a gun. Frank ducks, running for the door as Cooper UNLOADS. Rounds chew up the wall behind him... then slam into him, spilling Frank out the door. Cooper races after, bursting into the hall... But it's empty except for a spatter of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's hit in the shoulder and the side, in pain, forcin himself down the stairs. Stepping into the 4th floor hall, he pulls the first fire alarm he sees. As ALARMS RING, he presses forward through the rapidly filling corridor and catches a woman by the arm:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where's the server room?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: End of the hall. (seeing the blood) My God... But he's already in motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of servers fill this clean room, but Frank ignores them, arriving at the "FIRE CONTROL ROOM" off to one side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening the door reveals a small room filled with gas cylinders marked "HALON" surrounded by warning signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ALARMS CONTINUE TO RING, Sarah is frog-marched by two tactical badasses down this hall, hands zip-cuffed behind her back.  67. Rounding a corner, they are suddenly right in front of Frank standing beside a Halon canister with a fire axe. Frank takes a deep breath and swings, snapping the valve. PRESSURIZED GAS ERUPTS and suddenly Sarah and her escorts are writhing on the ground gasping for air that doesn't seem to be there. Frank wades in, cuts Sarah's zip cuffs and picks her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank drags Sarah up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Breathe out then in. You're fine. Just breathe. Gasping, she follows his directions, gaining control.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're bleeding!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Do you have the download? She pulls a memory stick from her bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge into the open hall overlooking the four story atrium where ALARMS continue to RING. Dozens of people fill the hall trying to figure out what' happening as emergency vehicles pull up out front. Security is everywhere. They're screwed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? Frank leads her forward to where he's stashed a second canister of Halon. SARAH (cont'd) What is that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It binds up oxygen in the air. Kicking it over he gets it rolling and... SMASH! The canister breaks through the glass panel under the railing, falls three stories and...  68.

dialogues.speaker: POOF
dialogues.text: Suddenly everyone is gasping and screaming, choking, flipping out. She looks at him in horror. FRANK (cont'd) Relax. It's just uncomfortable; feels like nerve gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stands outside the HQ buildings, scanning faces as people stream out, desperately searching for Frank. But PULLING BACK reveals there are THOUSANDS of workers flooding from the buildings. It's hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Sarah separate from the crowd, Frank leaning heavily on Sarah as they make their way towards the townc at the back of the lot. Marvin's behind the wheel, ramrod stiff, sunglasses on, staring straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Marvin, help me. But Marvin doesn't move. Getting closer, they see he's handcuffed to the steering wheel with a gun pressed to the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hold up! The back window rolls down revealing... ...JOE MATHESON. Frank can't believe it. FRANK (cont'd) Joe!

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (nods at Marvin) There's something wrong with this guy, Frank, you know, in the head. Frank grins.  69.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. (beat) You okay, Marvin?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Help him in here, honey. Sarah pulls open the door and settles Frank into the car beside Joe.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe kicks his wheelchair around to face the two killers. They're astonished to see he's got a 9mm semiautomatic in each hand.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Nah. Just retired. (to Marvin) Start the car, nutjob. Sarah closes the door and rounds the car heading for the front seat. JOE (cont'd) She's with you? Frank nods. JOE (cont'd) Nice work. Sarah slides in and Marvin pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS, GARY STEVENS, storms down the hall trailed by several AIDES and a SECURITY DETAIL. He's the man from the park who gave Cooper his assignment but now he seems overwhelmed to the point of breaking.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: They don't know how he did it yet. We're in lockdown.  70.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: Are we safe?

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: They don't believe he's still on site.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: (to Aide #1) I have the Director of National Intelligence calling for the Director of Operations.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: I'll call back. Wait here. Leaving the entourage, he pushes through a door into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debris is strewn everywhere. Cooper, arm splinted, gets up to face Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: How the fuck did this happen? Do you understand the ramifications of this breach? How this makes us look? The attention this attracts?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Sir...

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: Shut up. You just got your high- tech ass handed to you by your target. A retiree with zero resources. A man deemed too old to work in the field. Cooper's phone RINGS. He kills it. DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS (cont'd) I am NOT about to get hung out to dry. Do I need to get involved? Get someone else?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: No sir. Cooper's phone RINGS again and is silenced.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: I want this guy dead. I don't care if it's messy. Take whatever assets you need and finish it.  71. He turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stalks down the hall, furious. His phone RINGS again and he picks up.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You must be talking to someone important. Cooper goes cold. FRANK (V.0.) (cont'd) I was just calling to let you know there's a new list. And you're right at the top. CLICK. The line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank closes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Psyops! Hell yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Both hands on the wheel, Nutjob. Sarah turns to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The bleeding won't stop. We need to get help. Joe looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I know a place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull up outside this cute little B&B on the Maryland coast with gorgeous ocean views and a stunning garden.  72.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'll go in alone, see if we can stay.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous. I'1l go. Joe puts a hand on her arm. SARAH (cont'd) (realizing) Is this a thing? This is a thing isn't it? Everybody knows but me?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It'll be fine. Frank and Marvin exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: You want a vest?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Wouldn't make any difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank enters, the bell on the door JINGLING brightly. The place is adorable. VICTORIA sits in the dining room folding napkins. A littl older than Frank, she's prim, proper, and beautiful. She looks up, surprised. Then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (English accent) Frank Moses.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: It's been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah. There's a beat between them.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Are you here to kill me?  73.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No. I need your help. He slowly opens his jacket, revealing no weapons, but a lot of blood. She sighs, possibly disappointed...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Oh. ...and sets aside the HIGH CAPACITY MACHINE PISTOL she was concealing behind the stack of napkins. VICTORIA (cont'd) Come on in, then. And tell Marvin to stand down before he gets hurt. Frank glances out the window where Marvin sits in her rose bushes covering the action.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: By the way, your roses are fabulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others filter in and Joe and Victoria embrace.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Joseph.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Victoria. You're lovely as ever.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You old snake charmer. Sarah looks between them all, a little lost.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So. How do you all know each other?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Victoria was the best wet asset I ever worked with. A true artist with a PSG. Sarah shoots Frank a questioning look.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (aside) Killer. Very dangerous. Sarah smiles at Victoria, uneasy. She smiles back, warmly  74.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I'm gonna scout the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Just mind the daisies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Victoria sit alone as she peers through reading glasses, expertly working on Frank's shoulder with forcep and a sponge.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I'd better hurry this along or I'll be late with four o'clock tea. Frank studies her, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Make the transition? You have a beautiful place here. A nice quiet life. You seem so at ease. He winces as Victoria extracts the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I try. But it's not easy. Sometimes I get restless. (confessing) I still take the occasional contract on the side.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (hesitates, guilty) I can't seem to stop. I miss the rush. They retire us, but you can't just flip a switch and become someone else, you know. She starts stitching up Frank's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I didn't know what to do with myself. All I ever had was work. (more)  75. FRANK (cont'd) And suddenly there was so much time. (beat) I've done so many terrible things.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: We did them for good reasons. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Maybe. I'm starting to wonder.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Tell me about Sarah. Frank looks uncomfortable: much more so then when she was pulling lead out of him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: She makes me feel like maybe I could have a different life. Like normal people. Victoria smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: It's one of the reasons I've always been so fond of you, Francis: you're a romantic.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Hard on the outside. Gooey on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Gooey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin, Joe, Frank, Sarah and Victoria sit around the coffee table with papers and a laptop. Other guests chat quietly in the background.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is the reporter's list. This is the hit list we downloaded from the CIA. (more)  76. SARAH (cont'd) They're the same except there's one name that's not on the hit dist: Andrew Dunning.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Christ. He's CEO of Browning-Orvis.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: The defense contractor. Very politically connected.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Let's pay him a visit. Victoria pours more coffee.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You know, business is a little slow right now... Frank smiles wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper sits in his suburban living room, reading Frank's file as his wife, ELIZABETH, walks in, dressed for bed.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: What are you working on?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Just trying to figure someone out. My arm hurts too much to sleep anyway.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I hope you learned your lesson playing basketball with those Marines. Cooper gets up and gives her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Yes dear. She swats him and he pushes her back towards their room. COOPER (cont'd) Come on, I'll tuck you in. Halfway down the back hall, he pauses at a door, silently cracking it open.  77.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS' ROOM
dialogues.text: He looks in on his two boys, asleep in a bunk bed, each wearing different superhero pajamas. Cooper silently closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah stands on the balcony, looking out at the water. In the room behind her, Frank's cleaning his .45, but she can feel his eyes on her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Penny for your thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I was just wondering how you're holding up. TI know it's a lot. Sarah smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I've never been so scared in my life as today. But it was unbelievable. I'm okay. He nods, then goes back to work reassembling the gun. She watches him for a moment. SARAH (cont'd) Why don't you walk away? You could disappear, right? Frank finishes what he's doing and puts the gun down.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hide and go set up somewhere else? She nods. FRANK (cont'd) Dragging you along on this, I think about it. But letting this happen, then and now, I can't. She comes inside, picking up the cot that has been wedged into the room and moving it along one wall.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think you should sleep in the bed tonight.  78.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don't be silly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come here and let me explain it to you. Reaching out, she takes his shirt and pulls him into a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERED TITLE
dialogues.text: This epic mansion sits behind gated walls, surrounded by tennis courts, a pool, a helicopter pad, guest houses, and rolling lawns from the woods down to the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits with his back against a tree as Marvin checks it out with binoculars. They're both clad in black.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Rent-a-cops. Video. Infrared alarms. All the usual crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah lies in the dirt beside Victoria who sets up a camo draped rifle almost as tall as she is.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Frank said you wanted me with you.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: He thought it would be safer and I thought it would be fun to have a little girl time; get to know each other, talk about the boys. Plus I wanted you to know that in all the years I've known Francis, I've never seen him like this, so if you break his heart, I'll kill you and bury your body in the woods. Sarah looks at her, stunned. Victoria smiles.  79. VICTORIA (cont'd) This is going to be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A security guard escorts Joe, in his wheelchair and three piece suit, up to the main house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A butler leads the way into a sumptuous study: hardwood, heavy furniture, and leather.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Nice place. In fact, I'm not sure I've ever been in a room this nice. ANDREW DUNNING, portly and rich, sits behind his desk, looking Joe over skeptically. JOE (cont'd) How big is that TV?

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Mr. Matheson, was it? Joe grins.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: We just have a few questions. Suddenly Frank appears behind the startled butler, quickl zip-tying his hands. Marvin appears in another doorway, hustling in three security guards, their hands zip-tied behind their backs.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Put them with the others. Dunning looks between them angrily as Frank cuffs him into his chair.

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You don't remember me? (beat ) I remember you.  80.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. AFGHAN VILLAGE
dialogues.text: The man wearing a short sleeved civilian button-down step towards young Frank and Marvin. He's put on weight and lost hair, but the man is Dunning.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Tell us what happened in Afghanistan. A beat as this registers.

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: You can't touch me. You have no idea what you're dealing with. Frank glances at Marvin walking back in.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We have any idea what we're dealing with?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Not really. Maybe a little.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Can we touch him?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Definitely. Frank starts unpacking a bag: blowtorch, drain cleaner, Vice Grips...

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (to Dunning) Did you know that Frank here wrote the CIA field manual on torture? The old one.

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: Wait. Hold on a minute... Frank fires up the blowtorch.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I like this one. Where'd you get it? Dunning stares in fear.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Home Depot. Twelve bucks.  81.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No kidding. Frank holds out the torch and Marvin puts a pair of Vice Grips in the flame.

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE
dialogues.text: They glance over as though seeing Dunning for the first time. DUNNING (cont'd) I ran the Afghan operation.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What did you take out of there?

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: It wasn't a what. It was a who...

dialogues.speaker: INT. C-130
dialogues.text: YOUNG GABRIEL LOEB glances back out the cockpit door as Dunning drags aboard a YOUNG SOLDIER with a thousand yard stare, covered in blood and dirt.

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: We extracted a young Second Lieutenant. He was the son of then Senator, Henry Stanton.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE
dialogues.text: This quietly sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Robert Stanton.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The Vice President of the United States? Dunning nods.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Holy crap.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He was responsible for what happened there?

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: That's what the New York Times reporter wanted to know.  82.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What did you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: I said I didn't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Then you called the Vice President.

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: (defensive) Of course. Our families have been friends for years.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He ordered everyone killed. Except you.

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: I didn't know that! Victoria's voice interrupts, crackling over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We have major activity on the perimeter. Somebody serious is setting up shop. Dunning smiles at Frank, cocky once again.

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: You're finished. The Company's had me under surveillance since your little stunt over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria lies dead still, sighting through her scope as Sarah fidgets nervously.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don't see how you can be so calm. Victoria smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: So how did you two meet? This isn't what she expected, but Sarah allows herself to be deflected.  83.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We just started talking. There was something about him... (beat) Of course, now I'm a fugitive, the CIA wants to kill me, and I'm hiding in a hole.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I was in love once, with an agent.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: The relationship wasn't sanctioned. When it came to light, my loyalty was questioned. I was told to kill him. It was a test. She says it all so matter of factly. Sarah looks at her stunned.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I put three rounds in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavily armed COMMANDOS in body armor and black continue to unload from FBI vans as the FBI COMMANDER wades throug the deployment, finding Cooper and handing him a phone.

dialogues.speaker: FBI COMMANDER
dialogues.text: We're in position, sir. Perimeter's set. No one's getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin lies on the floor peering out a window.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: How's it look?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Remember the Alamo?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They have sniper positions on North, West, and East sides. (more)  84. VICTORIA (V.0.) (cont'd) Ground personnel in force out front and backup in the rear. I'd estimate sixty total. The phone on the desk begins to RING. Frank picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I've been reading your file.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Learn anything about how to be an agent yet? Cooper's calm and even, pacing as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: You've done a lot of service for this country. And when I put that together with your CIA visit where the only person that got hurt was me - I would say you value American lives. (beat) But if we come through that door, people are going to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I expect so.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: You don't want that.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I didn't start this.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I have orders.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: They're coming from the Vice President. He ordered these hits to cover up war crimes he committed in Afghanistan in September 1981. (beat) I buried the bodies in '81. They have you doing it now. You're killing everyone who was there. Cooper doesn't bat an eye.  85.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I don't believe that.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: If you did, would it matter? Cooper thinks it over, weighing it out.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So what do you propose to do about that?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: You give yourself up. I'1l take you into custody. You'll get to tell your side of the story. Frank smiles grimly.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sure I will. Even if you brought me in, someone would just put a bullet in my head.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: If you actually believe that, you're even more naive than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: You're surrounded. The FBI is going to take you apart. There is no exit here. But how it goes down is up to you. Cooper hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank watches Marvin laying out his numerous weapons. Joe puts a hand on Frank's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: We don't have a lot of options, Kid.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah.  86.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Somebody's going to have to make the tough choice if any of us are going to make it out alive. A long, quiet moment of understanding passes between them love and sadness. JOE (cont'd) I think you're going to have to give yourself up. Finally Frank nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper's phone RINGS. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hold your fire, I'm coming out. Frank hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: All units hold fire. Repeat hold all fire. He's coming out. 200 yards out, Cooper watches the front door of the house open and a lone, black-clad figure steps out, hands raise CRACK! A shot rings out. Frank falls. Stunned, Cooper looks around furious... COOPER (cont'd) Who fired that shot? No one says anything. COOPER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, reeling, realizing Frank was right: he's not in control of this situation. Cooper draws his weapon and charges towards the house. Frank lies motionless on the walkway. Cooper rolls the body over. It's Joe Matheson, dressed in Frank's clothes. He's dead.  87. PUSH IN on Cooper. Suddenly GUNFIRE erupts from the back of the house, and RADIOS ARE SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: FBI RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: FBI sniper teams are taking fire! Two suspects have broken perimeter!

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Marvin race across an open field, making for the woods in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: An FBI sniper and his spotter squirm down into their cove as rounds SLAP into the ground inches from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria lies prone, coolly squeezing off round after round keeping the sniper teams scrambling for cover.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Now isn't this worth sitting ina hole for? Sarah looks at her like she's insane. VICTORIA (cont'd) Keep an eye on the boys. When they make cover, we move. Suddenly they're taking SMALL ARMS FIRE. Victoria whips around, firing back, pulling Sarah up and pushing her into a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Marvin hit the cover of the woods and immediate change direction, scrambling uphill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen men charge towards the woods in pursuit.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah runs just ahead of Victoria, crashing through the forest... ...Straight into the arms of a black-clad COMMANDO. He pins her, covering her mouth as his three partners cover the woods behind her, scoping for Victoria. ...but there is nothing but SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank slips over the wall, Marvin just behind him. Sneaking up the perimeter, they suddenly raise weapons... ...and Victoria slips from the shadows with her rifle.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: They have Sarah. Frank turns back to the estate wall: he's going over. VICTORIA (cont'd) You can't. (beat) How many are you willing to kill? SOUNDS RISE as people crash through the underbrush behind them. Up the road, other forces are closing in. VICTORIA (cont'd) Live to fight another day, Francis. Sickened, Frank knows she's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of the COMMANDOS move in, covering the room. Dunning sits cuffed in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDO
dialogues.text: Clear!

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDO
dialogues.text: Mr. Dunning?

dialogues.speaker: DUNNING
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank God.  89. FSST!  FSST! The commando fires twice from a SILENCED pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leading the way out of the woods, Frank pauses at the edge of a creek and a small country road. A helicopter flies overhead, searchlight cutting the darkness. And directly across from them a limo sits under the trees The door opens and out steps Ivan Siderov.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Come! Now is not time to waste.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How. ..? The Russian smiles wide.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: You are not the only country with satellites.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: (aside to Frank) Why would he be helping us..? But Ivan is staring at Victoria.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Zaychick moy. She smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Hello Ivan. It's good to see you. Frank looks between them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Did he just call you... bunny?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Life, sometimes, is complicated.  90.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BACK DECK
dialogues.text: Victoria sits on the wide arm of Frank's chair, changing the dressings on his wounds. Through it all she somehow still manages to look stunning. Marvin's off to one side, staring out into the night. Ivan puts the finishing touches on a pitcher of martinis and pours a round.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: To Joe. Everyone raises their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: To Joe.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: A life of service and sacrifice. They drink. It's a long somber beat. Finally Victoria breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Does anyone want to discuss the fact that we're all dead?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: It ain't over till it's over.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: The CIA's being used as the Vice President's personal hit squad. It's a bit of a conversation crusher. Ivan holds up the pitcher.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Anyone like another? Victoria and Marvin raise their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: They say he's going to run for President.  91.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I don't think it's possible to outrun this. It's only a matter of time until they find us.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: You could come to Mother Russia.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: When hell freezes over.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: St. Petersburg in the spring is very beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Anyone else? They think it over.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Veritas vos liberabit. The truth will set you free.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Tell people?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: It's a thought.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: What about Frank's girlfriend? What's her name? The cute one. They'd kill her so fast. Of course they might have already. But they'll interrogate her first. In fact, she's probably getting waterboarded right now...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: What? He looks over at Frank who gets up, heading inside. MARVIN (cont'd) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands at the kitchen sink as Ivan walks in.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: You okay?  92.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: I want to show you something. He starts unbuttoning his shirt. IVAN (cont'd) Don't get too excited. Pulling it open reveals old scars from three bullet wound IVAN (cont'd) This was done to me by the love of my life. It seemed that what we had was not meant to be. But now she is sitting in my house drinking vodka.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Victoria?

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Three bullets in the chest. But when I woke up alive, I knew that she still loved me - or it would have been the head. Frank can't help but smile. Ivan buttons his shirt. IVAN (cont'd) Was a big risk for her of course, but one does crazy things for love. Look at me. I guarantee, helping you today is not a good career move. (shrugs) But you only live once, right? (beat ) Do not fear, my friend. With a small, dedicated group, there is little that can not be accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stands across the desk from Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Someone took that shot. That's either another team in play or someone in our ranks. And the Dunning execution? That doesn't feel like Moses to me. Stevens considers.  93.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: I'll look into it.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: That's it? Stevens is calm and thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: Do your job. I'll figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits in an interrogation room with an observation mirror, a table and two chairs bolted to the floor. The door opens and Cooper enters with Frank's file. He takes a seat across from her and sets it between them.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: There will be no lawyer. No one is coming. There will be no record of what transpires here. She stares at him. COOPER (cont'd) You're going to tell me what other agents are involved with Frank Moses, who helped him escape, and what his relationship is to that government. Cooper puts a satellite photograph on top of Frank's file that shows Frank, Marvin, Victoria, and Ivan by the limo, but if you didn't know, an ID would be impossible. COOPER (cont'd) If you cooperate fully, there may be a light at the end of the tunnel. Until then, there is nothing I can not do to you. Nothing. Sarah, shaking, slowly starts to cry. COOPER (cont'd) Look at the picture. She takes the file with trembling hands, and... Swinging as hard as she can, she catches Cooper full in the face with the six-inch-thick file. WHAM! He goes down and she's around the table and out the door.  94. ...where two LARGE GUARDS jump up, ready to grab her. Sarah stops, realizing it's futile. Turning, she walks back into the interrogation room where Cooper's regaining his feet. She looks at him, icy, all traces of false emotion gone.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The reason other people are involved is because they have honor and integrity. Stuff you wouldn't know about. (beat ) So do what you need to do. And they'll do what they need to do. And at the end of the day, we'll see who comes out in one piece. Cooper smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: You really do care for each other. Sarah stares at him. COOPER (cont'd) That's how I'm going to get him. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICE PRESIDENT ROBERT STANTON, sitting alone in his dark office, looks up from his desk as the Director of Operations is ushered in.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: Mr. Vice President.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: Gary.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: I just received a report that Andrew Dunning is dead. The Vice President considers, looking at him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: I heard.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: Is everything all right, sir?  95.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: He was a good friend. He would have been pleased I'm going to seek the nomination.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: Yes sir. (beat) Is there anything I can do for you?

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: No. Stevens walks out, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper's at his desk. Jackson and Thomas sit waiting. A phone RINGS. Thomas nods at Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Trace is running. Cooper hits a button and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Operations.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here's the thing, Cooper. With age comes a certain perspective. I'm not sure you have what it takes to appreciate my position. Cooper smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Try me.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (background) It's a land line.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOME OFFICE
dialogues.text: Frank leans back in his chair, rubbing his temples.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I keep going over in my head if I was ever like you: the blind ambition and misplaced trust. I don't know.  96.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It might help me decide what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: What are you thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: There's a lot of hard things about our business. But in all my years, it wasn't the killing, or the stress, or the pay that bothered me. I didn't even realize what it was until it was too late. Cooper looks at Thomas who whispers...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Almost there...

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's how anything you love can be used against you. It taught me never to invest. Never to care. (beat ) Once I became Frank Moses I lived my entire life without attachments. It took discipline, but I was damn good at it. (beat) And then I met Sarah. And now you have her. It's the worst thing in the world to know that your enemies could hurt the ones you love. The feeling of powerlessness is almost indescribable. Cooper sits back, smug.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Got him! Thomas excitedly scribbles an address on a pad and holds it up to Cooper. Cooper goes pale. He looks like he's going to be sick.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You there, Cooper?  97.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: (covering the phone) My house! He's at my house! Jackson and Thomas scramble for phones. Frank sits back, putting his feet up on the home office desk with pictures of Cooper, his wife and kids.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's just like I said, isn't it: almost indescribable. Cooper looks like a shell of a man.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Please... Frank's tone shifts.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Shut up! It's time to grow up and look at what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Don't hurt them...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Listen carefully. This is the part I was talking about where I'm not sure you have what it takes to understand. As the others shout orders behind him, Cooper listens, riveted. FRANK (cont'd) I've spent my life doing terrible things for the CIA because I believed what I was doing was right. But when you find out that you've been a tool for corrupt political ends, like I was in Afghanistan, and like you're are now, you have to take a stand. This is a stain on our souls, Cooper. There's a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The right thing. The moral thing. The thing you'd do yourself if you had any balls at all. (more)  98. FRANK (cont'd) (pause) I'm going to kill the Vice President. A reaction ripples through the room: oh shit. FRANK (cont'd) But my question, Cooper, is this. What are you going to do? CLICK. The line goes dead. Cooper sits shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SWAT van SCREECHES to a halt before the house, disgorgi men who swarm the house... ...scaring the hell out of Cooper's wife and children in the middle of a backyard soccer game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings and it's in Cooper's hand in an instant.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They're fine, sir. They never even knew he was here. Relief washes over him like a physical wave.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Let me talk to my wife. Jackson looks over at Cooper holding the line.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: Why didn't he take them? (beat) We would have. You have his girl. Cooper glances around the room. All eyes are on him.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rusty door rolls up revealing Frank and Marvin peering into this storage unit full of cheap dusty cabinets. Pulling them open reveals a trove of rifles, machine guns grenade launchers and mortars.  99. Marvin looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I want you to know I'm very excited.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Back in '78 I thought I'd put a few things aside, you know, just in case. Opening a locker, Frank pulls out a pair of vintage aviators and tries them on.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Explosives?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just past the ammo. Marvin opens a locker: blocks of C-4, detonators, and primer-cord.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I love you, man!

dialogues.speaker: SUPERED TITLE
dialogues.text: This swank Miracle Mile landmark rises into the night with a steady stream of limos arriving out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystal chandeliers hang above a red, white and blue decorated stage. Sumptuous tables surround a dance floor where a band plays as WEALTHY DONORS mingle. SECRET SERVICE AGENTS stand discretely around the perimet of the large room, watching guests schmooze.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Cooper confers with a tall thin man, AGENT BURBACHER, the head of Vice President Stanton's security detail.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: My team is set. You have anything?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: No. Burbacher keys an inconspicuous radio.  100.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: This is Burbacher. He's clear for entry. Cooper heads off stage as behind him VICE PRESIDENT STANT strides in, smiling a wide politician's smile as he's immediately surrounded and shaking hands. Cooper joins Jackson off to one side.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: Everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I just have a feeling. Cooper moves on and Thomas steps up.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: He has a feeling?

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: No wonder Secret Service is sick of us. As they look out, studying the crowd, Ivan Siderov passes behind them, wearing a tux, blending in perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper walks into the kitchen, instantly assaulted by bright lights, heat, and dozens of people yelling at each other in different languages. Surveying the perimeter, Cooper notes the placement of three Secret Service agents, and then heads out. But WE STAY, following a BUSBOY wheeling a trash can past Secret Service and outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The busboy heaves his can up, emptying it into a dumpster ...and is suddenly yanked up and over, disappearing insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling the can back inside past Secret Service... ...is Marvin.  101. Pushing the can into a dry storage closet, he reaches in, pulling out two heavy garbage bags which he sets on the floor with a METALLIC THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doorman opens a limo and out steps Victoria, looking absolutely stunning in a body-hugging, full-length gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria enters, garnering appreciative looks as she make her way to the ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY CHECK
dialogues.text: Stepping through the metal detector she generates a BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Oh, of course. Removing her heavy multi-strand necklace, she places it in a velvet tray held by a deferential young woman, then steps through cleanly.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am. But putting the necklace back on, she drops her clutch. Someone is there instantly, picking it up and handing it back.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Of course. He walks off. She closes her clutch over whatever he slipped her and presents her invitation to the table of GREETERS.

dialogues.speaker: GREETER
dialogues.text: Welcome Ms. Smith. It's a pleasure to have you at our 2012 victory fund gala. Victoria smiles wide.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: The pleasure is all mine.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper stands looking out the windows as introductory remarks drone on behind him. Pedestrians pass back and forth outside, but something catches his attention in the distance. A FIGURE stands across the street, watching the hotel. His collar's up and he's wearing a hat, but in the headlights of a passing car... ...it's Frank. Cooper's instantly running, yelling into his radio.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I have visual contact. Front of the hotel, across the street....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bursting from the hotel, Cooper races down the steps, gun out as he plows into traffic. Jackson and Thomas run after their boss, closing the gap until they reach him at the corner where the figure was. Cooper's looking around wildly, but there's no one there, no one retreating, nothing. Except... on a window ledge where Frank was standing, there's a single .45 caliber cartridge. Cooper picks it up, staring at the bullet...

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Back inside! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and Agent Burbacher square off, quietly but intensely, as the event continues behind them.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Moses is here. You have to pull the VP.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: Just like in Jacksonville? The moment there is confirmed threat, I will call it. Until then...

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I just saw him...  103.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: This isn't me. This is him. He's had enough of you. If there is something actionable we will act. Until then, this conversation is finished. He turns and leaves, Cooper staring after him, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: INTRO SPEAKER
dialogues.text: ...And so it is with great pleasure, I introduce to you, Vice President Robert Stanton! The crowd bursts into THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE as Stanton take the stage, waving. Cooper keys his radio.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Stand ready.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you so much. I'll keep it short, so you'll actually write those checks you're promising. As the audience laughs, WE CUT AROUND THE ROOM to all the Secret Service and CIA Agents in play. VICE PRESIDENT STANTON (cont'd) It is this group here tonight that got us into the White House. And it is this group that will keep us there. (beat) My friends, I have not yet made the announcement publicly, but it's my intention to seek the nomination of our party for the presidency in 2012. There's APPLAUSE and CHEERS. Burbacher stands at the front of the stage staring out into the lights... VICE PRESIDENT STANTON (cont'd) We've come a long way together, but our best years are still ahead! So be generous. Get your friends to be generous, and I look forward to speaking with all of you across the course of the evening. Jackson and Thomas flank Cooper, waiting...  104. VICE PRESIDENT STANTON (cont'd) God bless you all. And God bless America. The MUSIC KICKS IN and APPLAUSE EXPLODES. We PRESS IN on Cooper and...

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: A SINGLE SHOT RINGS OUT. Cooper draws, looking for the gun... ...but sees only Jackson and Thomas staring at him like he's crazy as other champagne bottles POP. VICE PRESIDENT STANTON (cont'd) Please join Adyline and me on the dance floor for a spin before dinner. Chagrined, Cooper holsters his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I'm stepping out. Couples fill the floor as he walks out past...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: scanning the crowd, waiting... ...and suddenly there is an arm around her, sweeping her around and onto the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Hello, bunny. She glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Moves like that could get you killed.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Your radiance this evening renders me almost speechless.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Almost. He leads a turn and spin which she executes perfectly. Ivan smiles wide. VICTORIA (cont'd) What are you grinning at?  105.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: You know I have always dreamed of killing the American President.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Vice President.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Tsch. Whatever. Having you in my arms again... I get carried away.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Tell me you love me. The song winds to a close, but he continues to dance.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: The song, Ivan. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Is it? (beat ) Ah. To work then. Breaking their embrace, he heads off...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Ivan! He looks back and fumblingly she tries to hand him a smal spray canister from her clutch.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes. Of course. He takes it, kisses her hand, and melts into the crowd. Victoria sits, flushed, and for the first time we've seen her, not totally cool.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: moves through the crowded reception, canister held low at his side, covertly spraying a PUFF here and there. People begins to SNIFF and a low murmur rises.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: makes her way to the main ballroom doors, pulling them closed. Stepping out, she calls back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Gas! Oh my God! I smell GAS!  106.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: on the opposite side of the room, pulls the fire alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper, splashing water on his face, looks up as ALARMS RING OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As SCREAMS RISE inside, Victoria pulls her necklace apart into individual cable loops, wrapping them through the handles of all the ballroom doors and clipping them shut, locking everyone inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANIC RIPS THROUGH THE CROWD with Ivan doing his best to incite a riot, running with hands above his head, screami like a little girl...

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: It's going to blow!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: is in full control, his team immediately locking down the vP, pulling him to the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: Stairwell two. Move! Move! Move!

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: bursts into the ballroom, stunned at the chaos before him: people screaming and running, totally out of control

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: (into radio) Shadow the VP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With two agents on point, four with the VP, and two in the rear, the Secret Service team hustles down the stairs  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONE Secret Service AGENT stands before this elevator, trying to follow the action on his ear-piece. Victoria appears at the far end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: LONE AGENT
dialogues.text: This is a restricted area. She smiles, smoothly making her way up the hall.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I'm sure I'm allowed.

dialogues.speaker: LONE AGENT
dialogues.text: Ma'am. Stop. This area is off limits! She continues forward, completely unfazed as the agent draws his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: (amused ) Put that away. Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: LONE AGENT
dialogues.text: Stop or I will be forced to treat you as a threat. She smiles even wider.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Look at this dress. Where, exactly, is the threat? The agent looks her over as she puts up her hands and closes the rest of the distance and... WHAM: the gun is twisted out of his hand as he takes a chop to the side of the neck and goes down. Victoria takes a moment to fix her boobs as Marvin enters the hall with two duffel bags. They step into the elevator, she inserts a fireman's key, and hits G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burbacher's point men burst out of the stairwell, coverin the garage and pulling open the doors of the waiting car. Burbacher and close security pile the VP into the car and it peels out, rounding a corner and...  108. Is ripped apart by automatic fire, heavy rounds pulverizi the front of the car, sending it smashing into a wall. Screaming commands, Burbacher forces the VP out, using the car as a shield as rounds continue to pour in.

dialogues.speaker: POINT MAN AGENT
dialogues.text: What the hell are they using?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: ... blazing away with a belt-fed machine gun. Behind her, Marvin fires bolts into the concrete, setting something up.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Burbacher screams into his radio.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: We're taking heavy fire! Everyone move in! Get a car in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper and his team run down the garage ramp from one level up.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Stay low, flank them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors give way and as a mass of trapped, screaming people charge safely for the exit, Ivan saunters after them, lifting a glass of Champagne from a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sipping the drink, he calmly makes his way to the elevators, tapping twice on the second one from the left. The doors roll open revealing Frank dressed ina conservative suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Good evening, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Ivan. He steps out as Ivan steps in, the doors rolling closed.  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOOTHING MUSIC plays in the background. AS Ivan descends, he begins to hum the RUSSIAN NATIONAL ANTHEM, quietly at first, then louder and more enthusiastically, conducting with his drink until... DING: the doors roll open onto chaos:

dialogues.speaker: GARAGE
dialogues.text: ...where a huge fire-fight is unfolding: the Secret Servi team pinned down as another ARMORED LIMO moves in to get them cover. Culminating the anthem, Ivan pulls a remote from his jack and presses the button: a huge explosion rips out the front end of the back-up limo.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The elevator doors roll back closed on the DEAFENING ACTION, and Ivan leans back, sips his drink, and listens to the SOOTHING MUSIC once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As smoke from the limo explosion fills the air, Burbacher grabs his guys, and the VP.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: We're moving! South Exit! Go! They break for the stairs as shots ring out behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper's team angles in behind Victoria and Marvin's position, one row of cars back, listening to the FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: On my command. Two. One. Go! They break, moving in, and... The machine gun stands on a tripod, UNMANNED, firing burs Cooper stares at it, furious, realizing... COOPER (cont'd) Outside! Outside!  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT, firemen, and EMTs pour into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun in one hand, Vice President's arm in the other, Burbacher leads the Secret Service team running through the access corridors under the hotel into a...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: Secret Service! Everybody down. Workers duck as the team crosses the room. But Burbacher sees something, shoving the VP down... ...as AUTOMATIC FIRE rakes the counter.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN AND VICTORIA
dialogues.text: In a side corridor. She empties the magazine and he hands her another as they watch kitchen workers scatter and the Secret Service return fire.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I remember the Secret Service being tougher.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Me too. But suddenly they're taking fire from behind, bullets SLAPPING in to the wall around them. Marvin ducks, drawing a machine pistol and spraying the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I think it's SWAT.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We have a problem, Marvin. He looks over. Victoria's on the floor, her dress awash in blood from a gunshot wound in her side. Marvin's instantly in motion, delving into a duffel bag, pulling cans of smoke, yanking pins, tossing them out.  111. With smoke adding a new layer of confusion to the SHOUTIN and GUNFIRE, he picks up Victoria, heading up a different corridor. He hustles forward as fast as he can, but the SOUNDS OF PURSUIT rise behind him. Marvin fires back down the hall, then pulls open a door revealing a utility closet and leans her inside. VICTORIA (cont'd) What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: No choice. She look at him, realizing he's right. Stripping off his jacket, he puts it around Victoria. Stepping back REVEALS he's wearing a vest, covered in plastic explosives.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Good luck. He gives her a wink.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: You only live once, right? He shuts the door, and takes off up the hall. A moment later, a SWAT assault unit sweeps up the hall after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria takes off her shoes, pulls Marvin's jacket tight around her and tries to stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stumbling out of the smoke, Burbacher checks the VP for wounds until Stanton pushes him off.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Just get me the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: Kelsey! James! Up front.  112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victoria makes her way forward, weak but deliberate, her breathing fast and shallow. Rounding a corner she finds herself at a steel security gate pulled across the concrete corridor. SHOUTS and FOOTSTEPS rise behind her. Defeated, she presses her face against the cold metal.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Perhaps I can be of some assistance? She looks up, finding him on the other side of the gate, already reaching through, picking the lock. Smiling as the gate swings open, she takes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secret Service team clears a stairwell emerging into a wide ground-floor corridor of the hotel. The corridor is empty, but Burbacher halts his team, looking around. From the darkness at one end of the hall, a lone figure emerges. It's Marvin, covered in explosives, holding a dead-man trigger in one hand. The VP looks up in horror.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: Go! The whole team takes off, pulling along the VP, running all-out towards the doors at the end of the hall. Marvin starts after them, fingering the trigger, screamin like a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion rips out of the hotel, a fireball billowing up into the night... ...as the Secret Service team spills out the door. People outside run SCREAMING in all directions, but...

dialogues.speaker: A SECRET SERVICE LIMO
dialogues.text: ...screeches to a halt beside the agents. Burbacher and another agent pull the VP into the car and it peels out.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN AND VICTORIA
dialogues.text: stand among the refugee guests, onlookers, and emergency workers, watching from a distance as the car disappears into the night.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: He made it.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: That's it then.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. LIMOUSINE
dialogues.text: With the VP between them, Agent Burbacher shares a look of palpable relief with the other Agent as the car SQUEAL around a turn, putting the hotel behind them.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: (into radio) We're clear. En route to airport now.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Copy that. The limo pulls onto the highway, speeding into the night.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: (furious) How the hell did that happen? Burbacher forces himself to keep cool.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: I don't know yet, sir. The other Agent checks behind them for a tail: nothing.  114.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER AGENT
dialogues.text: Looks clear.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Copy that. THE CAMERA SLOWLY MOVES FORWARD to REVEAL that FRANK is the driver. He puts on his signal and pulls over beneath an overpass.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT BURBACHER
dialogues.text: Why are we stopping? Frank turns and fires a tazer, sending him into convulsio The other Agent reaches for his gun, but ZAP, gets tazed as well. Stanton stares at Frank in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanton slowly comes around in the back seat, groaning. His Secret Service Agents are gone. His hands are zip-tied behind his back. Frank glances at him in the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Frank Moses. (beat) One of the men you ordered killed. The Vice President looks at him in fear.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Frank lets it go, just driving. VICE PRESIDENT STANTON (cont'd) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: From you? Nothing.  115. Stanton senses this is bad.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: I'm sure we can negotiate something...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So now it's coming back to you? Stanton pipes down. FRANK (cont'd) Or have there been so many that they all just blur together? Maybe you don't even think about it. (beat) I was prepared to live my life in peace. You couldn't even let me have that.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: I don't know....

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Afghanistan. I was there. Stanton suddenly looks like he's been gut-punched. Like he's about to be sick.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: Can we talk about this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You can talk all you want. Frank slowly pulls over into a deserted lot near an industrial waterfront area beneath the El tracks. FRANK (cont'd) But I'm still going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of the car, opens the rear door, and pulls Stanton out, spilling him into the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: On your knees. The VP crawls up, coming apart, on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: I didn't kill anyone. (sobbing) I tried to stop it. (more)  116. VICE PRESIDENT STANTON (cont'd) They pulled me out because my dad knew it wouldn't matter. I was there. Frank unholsters his old .45 and crouches down to look the VP in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's not that I want revenge. I don't care about you. But there are rules about how you treat your tools. The people who do things for you do it because they believe in the greater good. Frank holds up his set of dog tags. Now we see that the name and number have been filed out. FRANK (cont'd) I joined up when I was seventeen and took an oath to defend this country. They stamped these tags with the name my mother gave me. Later the Company erased that name forever. These are a symbol of that sacrifice. A train goes by overhead with a deafening ROAR. Frank levels his gun at the Vice President. FRANK (cont'd) Today I am going to restore honor to your office. Suddenly bright lights pin Frank.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Freeze! Cooper emerges from a car, weapon drawn. COOPER (cont'd) Do this, you're dead! Frank glances at Cooper, then back at the VP, as the POUNDING of a helicopter draws close.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I guess I'm okay with that. He starts to move, but Cooper pulls Sarah from the car, covering her with his weapon. She and Frank lock eyes. So close but so far.  117. He looks between her and the VP. FRANK (cont'd) I love you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I love you too. Frank looks at Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: She goes free. Cooper nods. FRANK (cont'd) Swear it on your family's life.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: I do. Sarah looks between them, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No... Frank slowly lowers his .45. It CLATTERS to the ground. Jackson and Thomas move in on him, guns ready. Frank puts his hands above his head, and as the chopper lands, kicking up dust over the scene, his eyes never leave Sarah's as he's cuffed. Stevens gets out of the chopper. Approaching Cooper, he eyes Frank and the VP.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: That's him?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: Good work. Cooper gives him a nod.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Yes sir. The VP approaches Stevens, still shaking, furious...  118.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: What the hell have you done? I asked you to find out who knew about Afghanistan to see if we could control the story. Frank watches this, trying to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: Which is exactly what I did. I protected this administration and made this campaign possible. With the stroke of a pen, I gave you a shot at the presidency.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: You had people killed!

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: No one who mattered.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: Americans!

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: Nobody cares!

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: This isn't what I wanted! Stevens smiles coldly.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS STEVENS
dialogues.text: These aren't details you need to be concerned about. All you need to remember is that you owe me. The VP starts towards him.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT STANTON
dialogues.text: Is that why you did this? Cooper steps between them, stopping the VP. He nods to Jackson and Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Escort the Vice President to the chopper. They pull him away, leaving Cooper and Stevens alone with Frank and Sarah. Cooper takes out a syringe.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No!  119. Cooper steps to Frank who stares him down, unflinching. Lashing out, Cooper jabs it into Stevens' neck. He gasps, eyes bugging.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: You disgust me. Clutching his chest, Stevens collapses to the ground. Sarah looks away. But Frank's eyes never leave Cooper. Uncuffing Frank, Cooper holds out his .45.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Maybe there's some hope for the Company after all.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Maybe. Frank takes the gun. Sarah leaps into Frank's arms and they embrace. COOPER (cont'd) I want you to come back home.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Home?

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: A chance to work again. To train the next generation. Frank considers, then tosses Cooper his tags and takes Sarah's hand.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm retired. Cooper watches them walk away.

dialogues.speaker: COOPER
dialogues.text: Where are you going to go, Frank? What else do you have? But suddenly a figure steps out of the darkness to meet Frank: Marvin, carrying a RPG. And then another figure emerges: Victoria, rifle slung. A car starts in the darkness and pulls close: Ivan's behi the wheel, still dressed in his tux. Frank and Sarah embrace their friends.  120. Frank looks back at Cooper, then slips into the car and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Sarah kiss... And Ivan leans back, totally interrupting.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: So Frank. I was wondering if you would go on little errand with me. Victoria turns from the front passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: His timing is terrible.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Is just a tiny little nuclear problem in Moldova. A day or two, no big thing. Sarah, you will love the countryside. Frank looks at him, stunned. Marvin, squeezed in next to him, elbows him in the side.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Come on, man, it's just the safety of the world. Frank's about to answer and we... FADE OUT.
